channel.title: Pacific portraits
channel.description:
This series explores various aspects of the Pacific region through dramatization, narration, commentary and music.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Captain Cook's early voyages
item.description: The early exploration of the Pacific and the foundation of British power there.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Cook, James, 1728-1779

item.title: Paul Gauguin
item.description: The attraction of the South Seas for the artist.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Gauguin, Paul, 1848-1903

item.title: Charles Darwin
item.description: Development of scientific interest in the Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Darwin, Charles, 1809-1882

item.title: Sir Hubert Murray
item.description: Problems of administration of the native peoples in the area.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Murray, Hubert

item.title: Father Damien
item.description: The impact of missionaries on Pacific peoples.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Damien, Saint, Father, 1840-1889

item.title: Katherine Mansfield
item.description: The recent literature of the area and the "homing" instinct of the Dominion-born.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Mansfield, Katherine, 1888-1923

item.title: Captain Bligh
item.description: The later exploration of the area, white settlement and early conditions in Australia.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Bligh, William, 1754-1817

item.title: Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: Another aspect of literary life in the Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Stevenson, Robert Louis, 1850-1894

item.title: Dame Daisy Bates
item.description: The relationship between whites and native races in the area.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Aboriginal Australians.

item.title: Matua of Fiji
item.description: This program examines problems of racial clashes and relationships in Fiji.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Fiji--Social conditions

item.title: Herman Melville
item.description: Early literary impressions of the Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Melville, Herman, 1819-1891

item.title: Sir Peter Buck
item.description: New Zealand life in terms of one of its more distinguished native products. "Sir Peter Buck"
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: New Zealand--History.

item.title: Dr. Grossman of the Solomons
item.description: Dr. Grossman, a medical missionary, is a fictitious character used to highlight postwar developments in the Western Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Reid, J. C. (John Cowie), 1916-1972
item.dc:subject: Missionaries--Solomon Islands
